text: [Music]
[Applause]
Spring has finally arrived in Washington
DC I got here just in time for the
warmer weather cherry blossoms are
thriving outdoor cafes are opening and
people are coming out of winter
hibernation it's actually my second time
in DC I came here 13 years ago for an
eighth grade field trip which I can
hardly remember so today I'll be taking
you on a three-hour Segway journey of DC
to show you the ins and outs of my
nation's capital which I discovered on
KK days new app and of course I'll teach
you some history along the way if you've
never ridden a Segway before these
things are so much fun it's a great way
to cover a lot of ground outdoors
without any effort I was fully embracing
the tourists look the white house so the
white house was completed in 1800 the
official residence and workplace of
every president since John Adams it's
actually a lot smaller in person than it
looks on TV then we went up Philadelphia
Avenue to the US Capitol home of
Congress and the seat of the legislative
branch of the US federal government also
where the president gets inaugurated
every four years the Lincoln Memorial
going to say hi to Abraham Lincoln real
quick a massive statue of Abraham
Lincoln completed in 1922 the site where
MLK's I have a dream speech was and just
an all-around great Memorial Washington
Monument made of marble and granite this
is the world's tallest stone building
standing at 555 feet five inches it was
the tallest structure in the world from
1884 to 1889 surpassed by the Eiffel
Tower World War two Monument lastly we
visited this lovely monument dedicated
to those who fought in World War two we
were even lucky enough to meet some of
them today so these are all World War
two books
here at the memorial but aside from all
the famous monuments Washington DC is
scattered with so many cool buildings it
kind of feels European with the old
architecture and there aren't any
skyscrapers I was impressed it's been a
really special experience being here
something just hits home it's the
foundation of my land and I can
reconnect with my roots I think every
American should come to DC at least once
in their life so they can see and feel
where this country began Washington DC I
will be back
I'm drew pinsky and if you like my
travel videos please click Subscribe and
join me as I plan to visit every country
in the world
